abstract.text: Pass image data between the Core Graphics framework and the vImage library.

inlineContent.text: The vImage library uses the
class as the main type to consume and produce still images. A
instance may originate from
or
images, or from a
drawing destination.
A typical Core Graphics-based vImage workflow consists of:
Selecting a source image, such as a Core Graphics-backed
instance.
Initializing a vImage buffer from the imageâ€™s bitmap data.
Performing an operation on the vImage buffer, such as scaling or adjusting gamma.
Creating a destination image from the operation result with the same image format as the source image.
vImage provides the following functions that simplify interoperation with Core Graphics:
initializes a vImage buffer with the contents of a Core Graphics image.
creates a Core Graphics image from a vImage buffer.

image, populates a vImage buffer from the image, and generates a
image from the buffer.

abstract.text: Make large-scale mathematical computations and image calculations, optimized for high performance and low energy consumption.
